thread.title: Tottenham could have signed nemesis Sadio Mane but owner Daniel Levy failed to match his wage demands
thread.title_full: Tottenham could have signed nemesis Sadio Mane but owner Daniel Levy failed to match his wage demands

author: rforrester
title: Tottenham could have signed nemesis Sadio Mane but owner Daniel Levy failed to match his wage demands
text:
Not enough Mane Tottenham could have signed nemesis Sadio Mane but owner Daniel Levy failed to match his wage demands 
Liverpool star made sure Spurs knew what they were missing as the forward condemned Mauricio Pochettino's side to defeat By Richard Forrester Comments TOTTENHAM will be kicking themselves that they didn’t stump up enough wages to land Sadio Mane. Sadio Mane scored twice to end Tottenham’s title chances Watch for Philippe Coutinho bending down behind the wall to stop the ball going under it 
But the Senegal international could have easily been playing against Liverpool in the white of Tottenham on Saturday. 
Keep up to date with ALL the LIVERPOOL and TOTTENHAM news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club pages plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
According to T he Times , Mane went to Spurs' Enfield training ground for talks over a potential move whilst he was still at Southampton. 
However the club owner, Daniel Levy, failed to agree with Mane's wage demands. 
Levy is notorious for driving a hard bargain and sticks to a strict wage structure within the club - but the missed target could prove costly. 
Mane eventually signed for Liverpool in a £32million deal and he is earning his corn with 11 Premier League goals this season. Reuters Sadio Mane could have joined Tottenham this summer if Daniel levy stumped up his wage demands Related news Swansea vs Leicester team news: Fernando Llorente expected to shake off a niggle for Swans TEAM NEWS Burnley vs Chelsea team news: Eden Hazard fit for Blues as new-boys Robbie Brady and Ashley Westwood push for first Clarets starts SHOW ME THE MANE Liverpool 2 Tottenham 0: Sadio Mane scores twice in two minutes as Reds win in Prem for first time in 2017 Gift of the Gab Sunderland 0 Southampton 4: New-boy Manolo Gabbiadini bags brace as Saints run riot allen key Stoke 1 Palace 0: Joe Allen strike heaps further misery on under pressure Eagles boss Sam Allardyce TICK TOCK TONY Man Utd 2 Watford 0: Anthony Martial puts speculation over his Old Trafford future behind him with a goal and an assist in home triumph Footing the Bil West Ham 2 West Brom 2: Furious Slaven Bilic destroys TV microphone after Jonny Evans heads home last gasp Baggies equaliser Helping hands Arsenal 2 Hull 0: Alexis Sanchez punches in the opener and scores penalty after Sam Clucas is sent off... for controversial handball COUNT ME OUT Sergio Aguero ready to quit Manchester City this summer over Pep Guardiola's style of play Thierry Henry I poked N'Golo Kante to see if he was real... Chelsea's midfielder should be crowned PFA Player of the Year TURF MORE Burnley chief Mike Garlick has acquired a taste for keeping the Prem League battlers in rude health TIP-TOP CRIS Osasuna 1 Real Madrid 3: Cristiano Ronaldo on mark as Real are made to fight all the way Getty Images Daniel Levy is notorious for driving a hard bargain 
Tottenham's highest paid players are striker Harry Kane and club captain Hugo Lloris who earn £100,000-a-week. 
However Liverpool are willing to pay £150,000-a-week for their star players with Philippe Coutinho the club's top earner. 
Adam Lallana is another player who looks set for a wage hike. Liverpool 2-0 Tottenham : Liverpool win for the first time this year
